h3. Problem Definition
JIRA allows the creation of custom fields with similar name exist across all the projects. However, there are still no reliable solution on differentiating these custom field apart, especially on the column section.
 !whatcolumn.jpg|thumbnail! 

For example, 2 custom field with the similar name, however with different custom field type can be troublesome to differentiate when creating a filter

For custom field with similar name, display the custom field type next to the custom field name

Steve King
Product Manager

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the version description is not being displayed when hovering over an option in the dropdown menu when picking a version in the create or edit issue screen, or the create service desk request screen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62566].
  {panel}

We need a similar function at the issue level as provided in AtlaZon's JIRA VOTE FOR COMMENTS plugin [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/info.renjithv.votecomments.jira-addon-votecomments/server/overview]. Unfortunately, this plugin only enables voters to Like or Dislike a comment within issue and provides a summary tally of Comment Likes/Dislikes. It does not provide a way to see who voted for/against or who abstained vs did not vote at all.  This would provide a simple solution for electronic configuration control board approval (or not) for all JIRA Change Requests submitted to our baseline system.

Related to this requirement is that two of the People fields are not being captured/listed in the current JIRA Issue Activity/History tabs: Votes & Watchers. Only Assignee and Reporter are captured under Activity, etc. Is there a way to add the Votes & Watchers as another tab? That would help on the reporting requirement--sort of.

What we really need is to be able to generate Issue level and Project level queries and reports listing Users/Groups showing if and how each person voted, assuming functionality of voting For (Like), Against (Dislike), Abstain (Meh), or Not Voted (Slacker) is added. However, we can't do this now because the current JIRA VOTES field is boolean (either Voted or Not Voted) which only tells you if someone voted or not. It does not tell you if someone is voting FOR, AGAINST, ABSTAINING, is ignoring you, or just hasn't gotten around to voting yet.

Please add the ability to either customize or add additional values/options to the VOTES field or use the social apps like/dislike features already elsewhere in JIRA Comments and Confluence.

We are using JIRA version 7.2.0.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Like & Dislike Voting and Reporting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62561].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The link issue field only shows and searches "recently viewed" issues, unless you click the "search for issues" link underneath the field. Newly created issues do not appear. 

Though [the search for issues flow is documented|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/linking-issues-776997756.html], it is a confusing user experience for people who have recently created an issue and know of its existence. To them, the issue not appearing is an error. Requiring them to "search" for the issue is pedantic; it is a non-obvious and an unnecessary hurdle to them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a test project
 # Go to Backlog
 # Create 2 issue call Test A and Test B
 # Once you created the 2 issue, click on issue Test A.
 # You will see the issue details on the right and click on   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/704577869/ellipsis.png?version=1&modificationDate=1422393340385&api=v2|width=24,height=13!
 # After that click on edit_ and go to issue then find for Test B

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to find issue Test B

h3. Actual Results

We are unable to find issue Test B.

h3.  Workaround

 # After creating the issue, open the new issue in a new tab and then close it.
 # Find for the issue again
fields.summary: Newly created issues should be searchable in the issue link dialog

h5. Problem

The “View all issues and filters” link from JIRA's Project > Issue view does not actually list all issues related to the project. Instead it shows all _open_ issues.

 ** You may need to switch to "Advanced" mode to see the JQL

JIRA shows the issue navigator listing all issues related to the project
 !Screen_Shot_2016-09-19_at_2_22_35_PM.png|thumbnail!
h5. Actual Behaviour

JIRA shows only issues that are Open and related to the project
 !Screen_Shot_2016-09-19_at_2_24_50_PM.png|thumbnail!
h5. Workaround

Manually modify the JQL query to remove the resolution JQL function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62553].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Sometimes, the "Operations Dialog Box" (the one that comes up when you press ".") doesn't show the "Edit Fields" section, which normally allows you to quickly edit any field of the issue. 
h3. Environment
 * Customer's version: JIRA v1000.350.1

*We replicated it on the same version in a test instance*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * On the issue navigator, set "List View" as the default view.
 * Now when the user opens a url as below the problem occurs.

{noformat}
https://<<instancename>>.atlassian.net/browse/<<issue key>>?filter=<<filter id>>

{noformat}
However if you remove the filter from the URL then fields will be listed.
{noformat}
https://<<instancename>>.atlassian.net/browse/<<issue key>> 

{noformat}
*Note that both URLs are related to the same issue and when the user press "." it shows different results*
h3. Expected Results
 # Both URLs should show the fields.

h3. Actual Results
 # The URLs mentioned (the one with the filter and the one without) are showing different results when come up to the dialog box.

*More details on the video attached.*
h3. Notes

JIRA v1000.350.1
h3. Workaround

The URL without the filter works. Advise the customers to use that.

OR

Switch to "Details view" in the issue navigator.
fields.summary: Operations Dialog Box not showing the correct fields

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently it's no possible to change "_My JIRA Home_" once it's set to be "_Boards_".

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud version 1000.319.1
JIRA Server 7.2.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click your profile picture at the top right corner
# Within "_My JIRA Home_" section select the "_Boards_" option
# Click your profile picture again and select any other option but "_Boards_"

h3. Expected Results
Your JIRA home changes to the selected option and the page refreshes

h3. Actual Results
The option is selected in the menu but the screen doesn't refresh and when you click the JIRA logo the Boards view is still loaded and you can still see the "_Boards_" option selected when you click your profile picture.
 

h3.Workaround
Click on the option twice. The first click will not load the expected page, but the second click will load eventually.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62542].
  {panel}

One of the default JIRA workflows is to mark an issue as "Resolved" and then after verification to mark it as "Closed". Therefore we need a way to filter for all issues that have been marked as "Resolved" but are not yet marked as "Closed".

In JIRA Cloud when I click on "Issues" it defaults to "Open Issues". That's a reasonable default . But in the "Switch filter" list, there is no filter for "Resolved but not closed". There is a "Done issues" option, but that shows both resolved and closed issues, but for this use case we don't want to see see closed issues. We need to see which issues have been "Resolved" but not "Closed".

I'm aware that I can manually add some filter, and every time we add a project we can add this to some complicated Boolean expression to include that project in the filter. But that's not what I'm asking for.

* I don't want to have a filter that shows such issues across all projects. I want it to be shown only for the current project. Just like the "Done issues" filter.
* I don't want to have to add a new filter to each project. I don't have to add the "Done issues" filter, for example---it's just already there.

So please add a "Resolved but not Closed" filter that is available to each project _by default_. After all, the "resolved->closed" workflow is one of the default JIRA workflows, so there needs to be a filter for it.

See related service desk issue [JST-214454|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JST/issue/JST-214454].
fields.summary: Need default filter for "resolved but not yet closed".

h3. Problem Definition

As per the [Atlassian Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/supported-platforms-749382629.html] only Tomcat 8.0.x is supported. And one of our customer identified a NIO2 connector bug on 8.0.x.

[https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=60511]
h3. Suggestion

As some customers have certain conditions that require using Tomcat 8.5, such as using "HTTP/2", we could provide support for Tomcat 8.5
h3. Notes

From [http://tomcat.apache.org/whichversion.html:] *8.0.39 (superseded)* -> 8.5.9
{quote}Apache Tomcat 8.5.x supports the same Servlet, JSP, EL, and WebSocket Specification versions as Apache Tomcat 8.0.x. In addition to that, it also implements the JASPIC 1.1 specification. There are significant changes in many areas under the hood, resulting in improved performance, stability, and total cost of ownership. Please refer to the Apache Tomcat 8.5 Changelog for details.
{quote}
fields.summary: Support for Tomcat 8.5

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62536].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

When a user attempts to download the JIRA core source code, on accessing the page with a valid JIRA Software license, they get the error:

{quote}

There are currently no source downloads available for your license. Please contact us for further details.
{quote}

[Our documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Building+JIRA+from+source] states:

{quote}
If you want to browse through the JIRA Core source code, you can download it from our Core source downloads page. You must have a valid JIRA license and be logged in to my.atlassian.com with your Atlassian Id. You can download the JIRA Software source code (this does not contain the JIRA Core source code) from the Software source downloads page.
{quote}

+Customer's Expectation+

Accessing this page they should be able to download the source code.

+Actual Result+

Without the JIRA  core license, they cannot download the source code.

+My Question+

What is the correct expected behavior? As there is a lot of confusion and the documentation only adds to it as it neither says what license it meant hence leading people to assume it could mean a commercial license.

+What to Do+

# Can we have this stated clearly when customers are buying the license what they would be able to do(including what source code is available to them)?
# Can we update the documentation I linked to reflect exactly what license provides what access.
fields.summary: Clear Definition of What License is Required for Downloading JIRA Source Code

h3. Problem Definition
When user has multiple dashboards, JIRA will redirect user to the last accessed dashboard when logged into JIRA. However, the last accessed dashboard might not be the most frequest used dashboard. So, user will need to open the dashboard manually.

h3. Suggested Resolution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62522].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

JQL WAS searches should be able to map out a renamed user to the user_key stored in the issue change history. At the moment, you need to type in the old username (user_key) to retrieve results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an issue.
2. Assign it to a user with username (and user_key) fred
3. Assign it to another user (e.g. admin)
4. Rename fred to fred_normal.
5. Perform a JQL search for {{assignee WAS fred_normal}}

h3. Expected Results
The issue created in step 1 is returned in the search results.

h3. Actual Results
The issue created in step 1 is not returned in the search results.

h3. Workaround

Perform the JQL WAS search using the old username (user_key).

In the example from the reproduction scenario above, {{assignee WAS fred}}
fields.summary: JQL WAS searches should be able to map out a renamed user to the user_key stored in the issue change history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62515].
{panel}
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
(!) *Cookie-based authentication is _deprecated_* (!)

[Jira Cloud has deprecated cookie-based authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-basic-auth-and-cookie-based-auth/] in favor of [basic authentication with API tokens|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-basic-authentication] or [OAuth.|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication] We strongly recommend you use either of these authentication methods in place of cookie-based authentication.

[See the deprecation notice for more information.|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-basic-auth-and-cookie-based-auth/]
{panel}
 

The example [JIRA REST API Example Cookie based Authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+Example+-+Cookie-based+Authentication] page is incomplete, or at least the information in there is not sufficient for Cloud customers:

According to above page it should be enough to get the value for JSESSIONID sending a request to jira/rest/auth/1/session and set it in the header of the successive requests in order to have it working.

However, this is not true/not enough (at least in Cloud). Also other Cookies are returned in the header of the response containing the JSESSIONID value and in order to successfully use Cookie authentication you must provide all those Cookies in the successive requests.

*Example:* (from: [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-218465] )

In the first response I got back:
{noformat}
Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BBFK-DW9I-1O0T-XAI2|d1f29197aefac82758df8ba7af6718590a4af86e|lout; Path=/; Secure
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=39EB1259A8CA92F7E62B8F4348AE9884; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
Set-Cookie: studio.crowd.tokenkey=""; Domain=.zaansmeisje.atlassian.net; Expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:10 GMT; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
Set-Cookie: studio.crowd.tokenkey=k4G0k02877DJJRTeBG6EUQ00; Domain=.zaansmeisje.atlassian.net; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly 
{noformat}
Therefore in my successive request I set the same Cookies in the header then it works. If I only set the JSESSIONID value it fails returning "401 Unauthorized":
{noformat}
-H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BBFK-DW9I-1O0T-XAI2|d1f29197aefac82758df8ba7af6718590a4af86e|lout; JSESSIONID=39EB1259A8CA92F7E62B8F4348AE9884; studio.crowd.tokenkey=k4G0k02877DJJRTeBG6EUQ00;" 
{noformat}
*Full request and response:*
{noformat}
$ curl -D- -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username":"dbonotto", "password":"********" }' -X POST https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/rest/auth/1/session

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx
Date: Tue, 06 Sep 2016 10:32:55 GMT
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Connection: keep-alive
Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-AREQUESTID: 962x18637x1
X-ASEN: SEN-2330110
X-AUSERNAME: anonymous
X-ATENANT-ID: zaansmeisje.atlassian.net
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OUT
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, no-transform

h3. Workaround

When calling the session endpoint just store all the cookie information in a file and use that to authenticate. E.g.:
 # Store the cookie in a cookie jar:
{noformat}
curl -c cookie.txt -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username":"XXXXXXXXX", "password":"XXXXXXXXX" }' -X POST https://INSTANCE/rest/auth/1/session

OR

curl --cookie-jar cookie.txt -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username":"XXXXXXXXX", "password":"XXXXXXXXX" }' -X POST https://INSTANCE/rest/auth/1/session 
{noformat}

 # Use that to authenticate the successive REST calls:
{noformat}
curl -b cookie.txt --header "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X GET https://INSTANCE/rest/........

OR

curl --cookie cookie.txt --header "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X GET https://INSTANCE/rest/........ 
{noformat}
fields.summary: The documentation for REST API Cookie authentication is incomplete (for Cloud)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62513].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA is inaccessible and you get _This site can’t be reached_ error. Almost all incoming http threads except one are blocked waiting for cache {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} to be populated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Restart JIRA
# Initiate large number of call loading data from {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} cache, eg: URL: _/secure/BrowseProject.jspa_
# Check that JIRA is not accessible after some time. 

h3. Expected Results
JIRA is working fine

h3. Actual Results
* Almost all threads are blocked waiting for cache {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} cache, example:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
http-bio-80-exec-88" #306 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x0000000032d35000 nid=0x1cb4 waiting on condition [0x000000025e419000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000007b7c020f0> (a com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture$Sync)
...
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache$DelegatingLoadingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.cache.compat.delegate.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryToProjectMapper.getProjectContextIdsForQuery(QueryToProjectMapper.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getProjectsForRapidView(QueryServiceImpl.java:116)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getExplicitProjectsForRapidViewFilterQuery(QueryServiceImpl.java:103)

	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.ProjectBoardsHelper.getProjectBoards(ProjectBoardsHelper.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.getContext(BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.getContext(AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.context.ProjectContextPopulator.populateWithProject(ProjectContextPopulator.java:77)

{code}
* 1 thread is populating the cache {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} and same thread meanwhile busy doing other slow task, one of possible examples: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-bio-80-exec-121" #345 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00000000342d3800 nid=0x1130 runnable [0x0000000262a98000]

	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)

{code}

h5. Known slow tasks causing slow getProjectContextIdsForQuery population
* loading data for {{getVersionsByName}} cache from DB which is slow for large number of version:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-bio-80-exec-121" #345 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00000000342d3800 nid=0x1130 runnable [0x0000000262a98000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)

...

	at com.atlassian.jira.project.version.DefaultVersionManager.getVersionsByName(DefaultVersionManager.java:577)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.resolver.VersionResolver.getIdsFromName(VersionResolver.java:30)
...
        com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.FieldPossibleValuesAdapterImpl.possibleValuesForIssueInput(FieldPossibleValuesAdapterImpl.java:21)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.FieldPossibleValues.getProjectIdsForQuery(FieldPossibleValues.java:38)
...
	at com.atlassian.cache.compat.delegate.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryToProjectMapper.getProjectContextIdsForQuery(QueryToProjectMapper.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getProjectsForRapidView(QueryServiceImpl.java:116)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getExplicitProjectsForRapidViewFilterQuery(QueryServiceImpl.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.findProjectsByRapidView(ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.findRapidViewsByProject(ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.ProjectBoardsHelper.getProjectBoards(ProjectBoardsHelper.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.getContext(BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.getContext(AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.context.ProjectContextPopulator.populateWithProject(ProjectContextPopulator.java:77)
...
{code}
See JRA-62666
This is fixed in recent version of JIRA

h3. Notes
h4. Verification
Taking thread dumps as per [Generate a Thread Dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Generating+a+Thread+Dump] during problematic periods of slowness, and searching for the below stack traces can indicate this is a problem:

{code:borderStyle=solid}
grep -c 'http-bio-80-exec' thread_dump1.txt 
150

grep 'http-bio-80-exec' thread_dump1.txt | grep -c 'waiting on condition' 
145

grep -A 20 'http-bio-80-exec' thread_dump1.txt | grep -c 'getProjectContextIdsForQuery' 
145

grep 'http-bio-80-exec' thread_dump1.txt | grep runnable 
"http-bio-80-exec-37" #255 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x000000002b37d000 nid=0x1c48 runnable
{code}

h5. Other notes
This actual bug is not caused by large number of version, but happy assumption in cache loader {{getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} that it will take feasible amount of time
to resolve queries
Problem with large number of versions is mitigated in [JRA-62666|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-62666] bug and fixed in JIRA 7.1.2 and 6.4.14

h3.Workaround 
Applicable for JIRA 6.4.x, From JRA-45178 
Use the following steps below. 
# Disable the {{board-scope-filter}} module in JIRA Agile Add-on ({{board-scope-filter}} module tells the sidebar the list of boards to show on the board dropdown as well as the board that is currently selected.). This will disable {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.getContext}} method. 
## Navigate through Administration menu > Add-ons > Manage Add-ons > Select 'JIRA Agile'
## Expand the JIRA Agile Add-on modules
## Find the 'board-scope-filter' module and disable it.
# Disable Project Navigation (Sidebar project navigation) for all users: Administration Menu > System > Project Navigation
fields.summary: all JIRA threads is blocked waiting for cache getProjectContextIdsForQuery

Currently No workaround is available

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no any permission that can be set for the [Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Creating+Release+Notes] specifically except the Browse Projects permission.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Upgrading of JIRA does not remove the older/deprecated jar files which may cause start up problem after the upgrade. This is especially when the instance is carried over the upgrade from JIRA 5 or older.

h3. Suggested Solution
During upgrade of JIRA, JIRA to check deprecated jar files and remove them accordingly before the start up.

h3. Workaround 
Remove the deprecated jar files manually.
fields.summary: Auto remove deprecated jar files(plugins) after upgrading JIRA

h3. Summary
If the assignee field is added to the create issue screen, and a the permission scheme is set with "any logged in user" for Create issue and Assign User, BUT *DOES NOT* include the Browse Project permission.  If the user creating an issue clicks into the Assignee field they trigger a pop up error


h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
** Tested on v1000.319.1
* JIRA Server
** 7.2.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add assignee field to Create issue Screen (Default configuration)
# Using the Default Permissions scheme or creating a custom scheme which has "Application Access any Logged in user" allow permission for:
## Assign Issue
## Create Issue
#  Remove permission *Browse Project* for "any logged in user" 
# Log in as a user that does not have Browse Project permission
# User also has browse users global permission
# Create issue in the project
# Select the assignee field

h3. Expected Results:
assignee field works as you are allowed to add assignee and browse users via permission scheme, or a warning indicating "you do not have adequate permissions to browse project details, Please contact your administrator" is displayed

h3. Actual Results
A popup warning is triggered:
{quote}
<URL_TO_INSTANCE> says:
The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the results of this operation.

[ ] Prevent this page from creating additional dialogs.
{quote}
!Screen Shot 2016-09-09 at 10.21.50 AM.png|thumbnail!

The following 404 appears in development tools javascript console
{code}
batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=tru…:6011 GET https://<INSTANCE_NAME>/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/multiProje…earch?username=&projectKeys=TEST&maxResults=50&startAt=0&_=1473435327305 404 (Not Found)XMLHttpRequest.send @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:1271_handleCharacterInput @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3410_handleCharacterInput @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3410click @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3410_dispatchers.(anonymous function) @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:1274dispatch @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:120h @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:112

readyState  : 4,

aborted     : undefined,

{code}
 
h3. Notes:
Testing discovered:
- If you know a user name you can add it to the field dismiss the error and create the issue and the assignee will populate
- An additional error occurs if you select the option *Prevent this page From Creating Additional Dialogs.*
-- After selecting the prevent option
-- If you try to modify the assignee field the Page locks up Indefinitely and cannot be escaped (ESC key, cancel Button)
--- there are two ways to exit the page at this point:
----  refreshing the page, and erase all content
---- Select the Create Button, but no other content can be added to the Create issue screen once locked, and as the user does not have browse project permission the issue cannot me changed later


h3.Workaround's
# Add Reporter to the *browse Project Permission* which will allow the user to View any Issue that they are the reporter on. 
# Use [Issue collector | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/using-the-issue-collector-802592637.html] which can set the assignee to the project lead with the use of use the Default Assignee of a project (Project Lead) for issues created.
# Remove the assignee field from the create issue screen
# Remove the user's association from the Assign issue permission to remove the field as an option on create for users without the permission
# Remove the user's association from the Create issue permission so the user cannot create issue in the project that they cannot browse

To remove the Locking issue from selecting *Prevent this page From Creating Additional Dialogs.* Flush Browser cache and the error popup will return.
fields.summary: Create Issue without Browse Project triggers 404 on assignee field

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 6.3 it was still possible to edit the color of the drop down icons in the JIRA header through the Look and Feel settings by editing the "Header Text Color". This is no longer the case since JIRA 6.4.

h4. JIRA 6.3: 
!image-2016-09-09-21-40-05-258.png|thumbnail! 

h4. JIRA 6.4 and above:  
!image-2016-09-09-21-41-09-069.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the drop down icons's color to be configurable via the Look and Feel page again.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62478].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Today when moving an issue to another project, the Step 4 shows the fields which will lose the value after the move. However, dynamic fields (like a custom field from the [Database Custom Field plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.keplerrominfo.jira.plugins.databasecf/server/overview] will appear there, even if the value is the same after the move.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if JIRA can consider the value after the move as well for dynamic fields, avoiding the information during the move process.
fields.summary: Move issue is not considering dynamic fields

It isn't possible to view a dashboard as wallboard if it has the Time Report gadget (By Andriy Zhdanov) added to it.

*Steps to reproduce the issue:*

# Create new dashboard
# Add Time Reports gadget
# Click on view as wallboard

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when you open the comma separated values (CSV) file in excel on computers that have regions set to places like *Dutch (Belgium)*. Then when you open the csv file generated from JIRA in excel, the columns are not separated and all the values show up on a single column in excel. 

This seems to be due to the regional settings. In English (US) region, this is the normal configuration:
 !regional.png|thumbnail! 
However, when you set to a region like *Dutch (Belgium)*, then the decimal symbol is set by default to comma and the Digit Grouping is set by default as a period. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable customers from regions like *Dutch (Belgium)* to open csv exports without any issues.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62469].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The preparation to upgrade JIRA is very cumbersome. 
# There are too much to read, but there are no checklists to help us in determining if we have got some important upgrade tasks covered. 
# There are things that we might have missed out but the instance is upgraded with problems, eventually, we need to roll back to fix the problems.

h3. Suggested Solutions
* An upgrade hub to suggest upgrade tasks based on the requirements and more intuitive. For example
** from and to JIRA versions
*** Any blocker issues for a particular version upgrade?
** from and to JIRA Software/Service Desk versions
** database server type and collations
*** Is the currently using database server version and driver still supported in the targeted JIRA version? If not, indicate the supported versions.
** license(s) validity
* A centralized knowledge base of all documentation related to Upgrading JIRA i.e. Upgrade method, process, upgrade notes

h3. Workaround
* Test upgrade and reach out to JIRA Support if there're any problems in the UI or errors in the logs
* Reaching out to Support before performing upgrade might help to avoid some problems too, however, Support can only advise based on known issues and documented requirements. There are too many causes of failed upgrade or errors varies because of environment and data, hence test upgrade is the best approach.
fields.summary: As an admin, I hope Upgrading JIRA can be less tedious

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a custom field configuration is edited and then an issue using that configuration is edited, the *custom field values revert to null or the default option*.

Users are not likely to notice unless they are attempting to change that field. If they do happen to notice they cannot see the original value in order to restore it to the correct value.
h3. Environment

JIRA 6.4.14, JIRA 7.1.9, JIRA 7.2.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom Field called "Test" using the "Select List (single choice)" type.
 # In the default/Global field configuration, configure three options: A, B, C.
 # Create an issue in Project FOO and set the field value to "B".
 # Create a new custom field context.
 # Configure the same three options for the field in this configuration: A, B, C.
 # Configure Project FOO to use this field configuration for the type of issue you created in Step 3.
 # Click "Edit" for the issue you created previously.

h3. Expected Results
 * After the field configuration is changed, existing values for the field should be preserved unless they cannot be mapped to options in the new configuration.
 * Alternatively, JIRA should highlight the modified field values in some way so the user knows they must make a change in the Edit screen.

h3. Actual Results
 * If the user does not modify anything on the "Edit" screen and clicks update, the field value will be changed to either 'None' or the first available field option.
 ** If the field is *optional*, the field will be set to 'None' in the Edit screen.
 ** If the field is *required*, the field will be set to the first available option, not the default option, in the Edit screen.

h3. Workaround

Administrators: After changing the field configuration for a project, for each custom field value you wish to preserve...
 # Search for issues that have the custom field set to that value.
 # Bulk edit the issues to set them to the correct value in the new field configuration (even if that value matches the default field config)

Detailed description and steps for the workaround are at [Change Context for an Existing Custom Field Without Losing Old Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-context-for-an-existing-custom-field-without-losing-old-data-674990056.html].
fields.summary: Changing a custom field configuration changes the values of custom fields when issues are edited

# Associate the first field configuration with an issue type and associate another issue type with the next field configuration.
# Associate the new Field Configuration Scheme with a project.
# Create an issue with an issue type which has "Affects Versions" hidden.

# Move the issue to the another issue type which has the "Affects Versions" required.

h3. Actual Results

User is not able to move the issue because they are not able to map the "Affects Version".

 !Bug.png|thumbnail!

None.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62442].
  {panel}

In JIRA 7, there is a Java API to just about everything _except_ the issue transition history, which is stored in the OS_HISTORYSTEP table with some links to CHANGEGROUPS/CHANGEITEMS for changes of workflow.

Because of the complexities of correctly reading the transition history while taking into account the potential changes in the workflow, it would be really nice to have a proper Java API (and possibly REST API as well) to properly access the transition history.

By transition history, I mean for each transition executed on an issue:
- timestamp
- transition ID 
- transition name
- author of the transition
fields.summary: Java API to OS transition history

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, it is mandatory to put First or Last Name in issue creation hence, when only adding a single word to the "Full Name" field, the user is still created and it will map as its Last Name. This makes it not possible to guarantee data consistency for all your user's first and last names. Also, this will reflect any Application that needs the object for other purposes.

h3. Suggested Solution:
An option where to make JIRA able to detect that there is only a single word inputted on the field and it will prevent the issue creation until the actual Full Name is provided.
fields.summary: To force user to include their First and Last Name in user creation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62439].
  {panel}

Dear JIRA community,

As an end-user I find the possibility to reply to comments by email very useful.

Unfortunately, when I receive a notification by email, it only displays the full name of the person publishing the commenting, and if I want to reply and mention the user (so that s/he receives an e-mail notification) using the syntax [~user_id_of_the_person_to_notify], first I have to get the corresponding user id, either in the JIRA's directory or by checking the user id on the ticket in the browser.

This is not convenient cause it requires to connect / check specific webpages, so it cuts down the facility to notify directly by mentioning the user in the reply by email (as you need to know the user id), and it's time consuming / error-prone for big organizations where there are a lot of people posting comments as the user id has to be retrieved every time.

A simple solution would be to add the user id next to the labels referencing a name, so that we can directly mention the user when replying by e-mail.

For instance for the following labels (bold text would be the information to add):
 * DOE John *(doejohn)* commented on XXXX-425
 * Reporter: DOE John *(doejohn)*
 * Assignee: DOE Jane *(doejane)*

Is there a way to do this ?

Can it be an improvement for JIRA in the future ?

Thanks a lot for your help,

Best regards,

Alexandre 8)

PS: for info, a thread has been opened on Atlassian Answers but no feedback received [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/40355363/display-userid-of-people-commenting-replying-to-comments-in-email-notifications]
fields.summary: Display userid of people commenting / replying to comments in email notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Summary

Calling rest api in-parallel causes JIRA to return 500 error.

 
h3. Steps to reproduce

Call JIRA rest api for JQL search in parallel (5 threads or more)

 
h3. Actual results

Server starts returning 500 response codes
h3. Expected Result

Server response without error.

 
h3. Environment

 

Script that was used:
{code:java}
var rest = require('rest');
var mime = require('rest/interceptor/mime');

var client = rest.wrap(mime);

var baseUrl = "https://jira.example.com/rest/api/latest/";
client({path: baseUrl + "field?"}).then(function(){
  return client({ path: baseUrl + 'project' });
}).then(function (data) {
  for (var i in data.entity) {
    var e = data.entity[i];
    client({ path: baseUrl + 'search', method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, entity: { jql: 'project = ' + e.key} }).then(function(data) {
      return client({ path: baseUrl + 'issue/' + data.entity.issues[0].key});
    }).then(function(data) {
      if (!data.entity.key) {
        console.log(data);
      }
      console.log(data.entity.key);
    });
  }
});





{code}
Running this in parallel (5 times) sometimes returns a 500 server error. The log is full of errors like these:

fields.summary: Concurrency problems with project and issue related REST APIs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62431].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
After the first startup, if an user uses the CSV importer under *Issues > Import issues from CSV*, the conversion of time estimates will misbehave.

*Example:* importing a file with the below data results in *Original Estimate* set to 8 minutes.

{code:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
Issue ID, Summary, Issue Type, Assignee, Due Date, Original Estimate
1, Test Import Task 1, Task, admin, 09/Sep/16, 28800
{code}

h3. Expected Behavior
Given our documentation on the CSV importer says that estimates should be set in seconds, the estimate for that imported issues should be 8 hours (28800 seconds / 60 = 480 minutes / 60 = 8 hours).

h3. Actual Behavior
Somehow, seconds are converted to hours correctly, but the unit is set to minutes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a new, clean JIRA instance;
# Create a new project;
# Create a new CSV file, making sure to include a time tracking field;
# Import that file using the importer under *Issues > Import issues from CSV*;

h3. Notes
If we deactivate Time Tracking under *Administration > System > Time Tracking* and reactivate without changing any options, the importer will work correctly.

Looking at the {{propertyentry}} table with the below query, we can see a number of options that are only added after cycling Time Tracking;
{code:sql|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
SELECT pe.id, ps.id, pn.id, pe.property_key, ps.propertyvalue, pn.propertyvalue FROM propertyentry pe 
LEFT JOIN propertynumber pn ON pe.id = pn.id AND pe.propertytype = 1
LEFT JOIN propertystring ps ON pe.id = ps.id AND pe.propertytype = 5
WHERE pe.property_key LIKE '%timetracking%'
ORDER BY 4;
{code}

h5. Before Cycle
||id||id||id||property_key||propertyvalue||propertyvalue||
|11| |11|jira.option.timetracking| |1|
|12| |12|jira.timetracking.estimates.legacy.behaviour| |0|

h5. After Cycle
||id||id||id||property_key||propertyvalue||propertyvalue||
|11| |11|jira.option.timetracking| |1|
|10362| |10362|jira.timetracking.copy.comment.to.work.desc.on.transition| |1|
|10359|10359| |jira.timetracking.days.per.week|5| |
|10361|10361| |jira.timetracking.default.unit|MINUTE| |
|12| |12|jira.timetracking.estimates.legacy.behaviour| |0|
|10360|10360| |jira.timetracking.format|pretty| |
|10358|10358| |jira.timetracking.hours.per.day|8| |

This doesn't seem to affect the administrator's CSV importer, triggered through *Administration > System > External System Import*.

h3. Workaround
Deactivate Time Tracking under *Administration > System > Time Tracking* and activate it again - without changing any options.
fields.summary: Missing Time Tracking properties on first startup causes CSV importer to misbehave
Jira REST API does not allow set Category or Issue Security to 'None'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62427].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When updating user picker value during a workflow transition screen, if the transition is blocked due to other system/workflow validator condition, after updating the field needed, the user picker value will not be updated properly

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a freshly installed instance, create a transition screen which has _assignee_ field and _summary_ field
# Summary field by default has a validator hard coded to it, where this field will need to have a value
# Append the transition screen to any workflow transition
# Publish the workflow
# Trigger the transition screen by performing the needed transition
# *Change the assignee field*
# Remove the Summary value to become empty
# When saving, the update will fail due to the summary field is empty
# Insert value to summary field, and resave.

h3. Expected Results
# Issue will be able to save with updated value for both assignee field and summary

h3. Actual Result
# Assignee field is not updated accordingly
 [^bug user picker transition.mp4] 
 
h3. Notes
After some testing, it seems that installing JSU and apply plugin validator to other transition will remove the bug. User picker value are updated properly
 [^bug user picker transition2.mp4] 

h3.Workaround
Unverified at the moment, however, worth to try. 
* Install JSU and configure other validator in the workflow.
fields.summary: User Picker not updating properly in a transition screen pop-up

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62425].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently users are required to go to {{Settings -> Issues}} and to make any changes to screens related to projects.  

h3. Suggested Solution

Add feature to JIRA to the screen management can be done in Project Management page.

Improvements:

1. Screenshot #1 shows 
- Issue Type view shall help user to see if any fields on screen will now be visible and why
- Each field line shall provide link to Field Configuration when field made hidden
- Each field line shall provide quick Field Context selection (existing or new one) when field doesn't have context for this project and issue type. 

 !JIRA-UI-Improvement1.png|thumbnail! 

2. Screenshot #2 shows
- instead of single screen JIRA shall show dropdown list of all project screens available for this issue type (Create/Edit/View + workflow transition screens)

 !JIRA-UI-Improvement2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 

Edit the screens from {{Settings -> Issues}}

h3. Problem Definition
Today we don't have a documentation for advanced expressions in the JIRA Services page.

h3. Suggested Solution
An information showing how to use these expressions would be awesome to avoid the use of regular cron expressions (Linux) instead of quartz.
 
h3. Workaround 
The page can be similar to [this one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER072/Constructing+cron+expressions+for+a+filter+subscription], however specifying the Services screen instead the Filter subscription.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62421].
  {panel}

Documentation Improvement Request:
 Add Instructions on Removing Home Data after setting the shared directory, and copying the content over.

Our documentation on installing JIRA Datacenter has instructions on moving the contents of {{data,plugins,logos,import,export}} to the local storage, however, there is no mention of removing this content after making this move. For customers with large attachements it may make sense to go back and remove this content as to not have duplicated data sitting on disk.

Example article:
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/installing-jira-data-center-802592197.html]
fields.summary: JIRA Datacenter Documentation on Removing Home Directory Content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62420].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a user selects a subtask from the Issue Details view and clicks the browser back button, the user is not taken back to the parent issue, but is instead taken to the backlog or issue search list.

h3. Environment
* Tested in Chrome in JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View a list of issues (e.g. perform a search).
# Click on a specific issue so that the full-screen detail view of the issue (e.g. story) is displayed in the web browser.
# Click on an existing sub-task to drill into the details page of the sub-task.
# Now click the back button in your browser. Instead of being taken back to the parent story case, you are taken back to the list view.

h3. Expected Results
You should be taken back to the parent issue view.

h3. Actual Results
You are taken back to the list of issues before the parent issue was selected.
 
h3.Workaround
Navigate back to the parent task from the issue list.
fields.summary: Browser back button on subtask takes user to backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62419].
  {panel}

h5. Summary

As described on JRA-62386: 

{quote}
When a saved filter contains a project, which JQL has the project name or project key, and a user that don't have permission to view this project access this filter, the project name/key in the filter change to its database ID to all users accessing this filter. 
{quote}

This makes Pie Chart gadgets unavailable for all customers.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a filter containing a project (or some projects), like project in (ABC, XYZ)
# Save this filter sharing it publicly
# Use the saved filter in a [Pie Chart gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-the-pie-chart-gadget-720417035.html]
# Set another user to have permission to view projects ABC and XYZ
# With this user, access a Dashboard with the Pie Chart gadget.
# Set a third user not to have permission in one of the projects (ABC or XYZ)
# With this third user access a Dashboard with the Pie Chart gadget.
#  With the second user refresh the page.

h5. Expected Results

The Pie Chart should be displayed normally for the second user.

h5. Actual Results

It returns the following error: "Unfortunately, one or more of your preferences are now unavailable. Please update your preferences, or remove gadget by clicking delete from the title bar above."

h5. Workaround

Share the filter only with groups/users that have permission to view the projects in the filter
fields.summary: Filters affected by JRA-62386 are breaking Pie Charts

h3. Problem Definition
When Synchronizing users/ Groups from LDAP, the group attribute, *description* is not displayed in the JIRA UI and there is no option to display it. The description is stored in the database table *cwd_group* but, we are not certain what is the use of it, when we are not using it anywhere in JIRA (UI perspective).

h3. Suggested Solution
* Display group Description in JIRA UI.
* Have an option to display group description.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround at the moment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62414].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Excel Export has been removed and replaced with the new CSV Export in JIRA Cloud. The delimiter is hard coded as a comma. This proves to be a problem as commas are commonly used in summaries, descriptions and comments of the tickets

h3. Suggestion
Allow users to change the delimiter upon export
fields.summary: Allow users to configure the delimiter in CSV export
